title: Calories in Sashimi
meta_description: Learn calories in sashimi per 100g serving, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown for raw fish like tuna or salmon.
assumptions: Raw yellowfin tuna sashimi, thinly sliced; no added soy sauce, ginger, or wasabi; typical sushi-grade fish.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by fish type (e.g., tuna vs. salmon), freshness, portion size, and any accompaniments. Consult sources or labels for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100g of sashimi provides about 108 kcal and 23g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: Is sashimi low in calories compared to sushi?
faqs.a: Yes, sashimi has fewer calories (no rice); about 108 kcal per 100g vs. 150+ for sushi rolls.

faqs.q: What fish has the most calories in sashimi?
faqs.a: Fatty fish like salmon (~163 kcal per 100g) have more than lean tuna (~108 kcal).

faqs.q: Does sashimi have carbs or fiber?
faqs.a: Typically 0g carbs and 0g fiber per 100g, as it's just raw fish.

faqs.q: How much protein in a sashimi serving?
faqs.a: Around 23g protein per 100g, making it a high-protein, low-fat option.
